intro: Ornithogalum sinense, commonly known as Chinese star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features strap-like, narrow leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum sinense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
